This law makes grants available to initiate peer mentoring pilot programs, develops training for mental health providers specific to law enforcement mental health needs, &supports law enforcement officers by....
We place so much emphasis & attention on our police officers’ physical fitness, but we need to do more to ensure they are mentally healthy as well.
Our hardworking men & women in #lawenforcement deserve better access to mental health services that will allow them to safely cope with the stress & trauma they experience on the job.
May is #MentalHealth Awareness Month 💚 Last year, the President signed into law a bill I introduced to support law enforcement called the Law Enforcement Mental Health & Wellness Act.

I’m proud this bill protects access to annual mammograms with insurance coverage with no-copay starting at age 40 by extending the moratorium on the USPSTF breast cancer screening guidelines, and...
If left in place, USPSTF recommendations put women, especially young women, at risk of losing insurance coverage for essential mammogram screenings that could save their life.

The #PALSAct would postpone U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) recommendations that could severely limit women’s access to mammograms, & was passed previously extending the moratorium on USPSTF guidelines to 2021.
That’s why I joined @DWStweets to reintroduce the Protecting Access to Lifesaving Screenings (PALS) Act.

Women of all ages are affected by breast cancer & every woman should be able to access mammograms when they need them. Taking preventative measures, such as having mammograms, are key components to combating a disease that takes the lives of too many Hoosiers and Americans.

This year, more than 40,000 Americans will lose their lives to #breastcancer. In 2017, the American Cancer Society estimated that 9% of new, fatal cases of breast cancer were among women in their forties.

The #JakeLairdAct is a gun violence reduction tool that will help us better avoid situations that could jeopardize the lives of our loved ones while also protecting individual constitutional rights.

This grant funding will equip police officers w/training & additional resources needed to deescalate life-threatening crisis situations & prevent future potentially deadly events from occurring in the 1st place. Since 2005, IN’s Jake Laird Law has been used +700 times in Indy.

The #JakeLairdAct provides grants to encourage states to adopt laws, similar to IN’s 2005 Jake Laird Law, that enable local law enforcement, w/probable cause, to temporarily remove & retain firearms from individuals who are determined to be an imminent danger to themselves/others
The #JakeLairdAct is a #bipartisan bill named after a police officer from IN, Officer Jake Laird, who was shot & killed in the line of duty by a man who struggled with mental illness.

As we recognize #NationalPoliceWeek, let's provide our law enforcement every tool possible to prevent senseless acts of gun violence from harming or claiming lives. I'm proud to reintroduce the #JakeLairdAct w/@RepTedDeutch @RepFredUpton & @RepDebDingell ➡️ https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/brooks-deutch-upton-dingell-reintroduce-gun-violence-reduction-bill-the … pic.twitter.com/kATuSBplc9

"U.S. Rep Susan Brooks (R-IN) on May 1 introduced #bipartisan legislation that would authorize more medical residency positions across the country to help combat the ongoing #opioidcrisis" Read more about the #OpioidWorkforceAct @RiponAdvance >> https://riponadvance.com/stories/brooks-supports-bill-to-train-more-doctors-in-treating-opioid-addicted-patients/ …

To learn more about our bill working to combat the opioid epidemic, including a list of organizations who support the #OpioidWorkforceAct, click here >> http://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/brooks-introduces-bipartisan-opioid-bill …

The #opioidcrisis will not stop taking innocent lives overnight, but without more trained doctors ready to help people who are struggling because of substance abuse, drug & opioid related overdose deaths will continue to claim more lives in Indiana & beyond.
The #OpioidWorkforceAct of 2019 would create 1,000 additional residency positions over 5 yrs to hospitals w/ addiction medicine, addiction psychiatry, or pain management programs.

This #bipartisan bill to expand graduate medical education (GME) aims to alleviate the worsening physician shortage, which is anticipated to be as high as 121,000 physicians by 2032 according to a study by @AAMCtoday.

This week, I introduced the #OpioidWorkforceAct with @RepSchneider @RepStefanik & @RepAnnieKuster to help provide more residency positions to hospitals that have programs focused on addiction medicine, addiction psychiatry or pain management.  http://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/brooks-introduces-bipartisan-opioid-bill … pic.twitter.com/ZC88KAdALA

In order to combat the devastating heroin, fentanyl & #opioidepidemic, a critically important piece of the puzzle is to ensure we have more trained professionals, particularly physicians, who can prevent & treat #addiction & substance abuse disorder.

Learn more about our common-sense, #bipartisan bill, the Fair & Equal Housing Act of 2019, here >> https://susanwbrooks.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/brooks-schneider-fitzpatrick-wexton-introduce-bipartisan-legislation …

I'm proud to lead the Fair & Equal Housing Act w/@RepSchneider @RepBrianFitz & @RepWexton so that regardless of anyone's race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, handicap, familial status & nat'l origin is treated fairly & equally under the law as they buy/rent a home

Housing discrimination & prejudice of any kind, towards anyone, is wrong. It is a fundamental American value enshrined in our Constitution to ensure equal protection under the law for all people in our country, including when purchasing or renting property.

They endured unimaginable suffering & it is hard to fathom the pain & agony they experienced. In today’s society, we continue to see violence, hateful rhetoric & anti-Semitism, which we must all stand up to & condemn.
